value.name: MPD chief: No specific crime pattern to homicides increase
value.description: Midland Police Chief Seth Herman said Tuesday that nothing “points to a specific crime pattern” when it comes to the increased number of criminal homicides in 2020 and 2021.  The city reported the latest came Sunday when a person died after being stabbed outside Club Arriba.

value.name: Criminal homicides continue at a higher pace started in 2020
value.description: The one-a-month pace would be comparable to 2020, when there were 12 in Midland, according to Midland police. The five this year already match the total for the entire year in both 2019 and 2018.
